model

Class Obstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.InteractiveObject
      • model.Obstacle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Obstacle
extends InteractiveObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    Obstacles the player must destroy or avoid. Subclass of InteractiveObject.
    Author:
    Alex Addeo, Zion Aranda, Katie Black, Michael Cisternino, Nick Hoffman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Obstacle

        public Obstacle(int x,
                int y,
                int initx,
                int inity,
                int width,
                int height,
                ObjectType t,
                RangeType r,
                java.lang.Boolean isVert,
                java.lang.Boolean isHor,
                GameController gc)
        Constructor for obstacle. A switch statement based on the type selects the object's picture.
        Parameters:
        x - The obstacle's x position.
        y - The obstacle's y position.
        initx - The obstacle's initial x position.
        inity - The obstacle's initial y position.
        width - The width of the obstacle.
        height - The height of the obstacle.
        t - The type of the obstacle.
        r - The distance the object will move.
        isVert - If the object moves vertically.
        isHor - If the object moves horizontally.
        gc - The game controller.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the obstacle based on the parameters.
        Specified by:
        draw in class InteractiveObject
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics to be drawn on.

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the obstacle based on the controller. The obstacle's moves based on whether the controller is moving left or right. If the obstacle is sitting on a block, it is not falling and y velocity is 0. If the item is falling, its y velocity is updated based on the current gravity.
        Specified by:
        update in class InteractiveObject
